title: Violet is Working Against Her Will
theoryText: When Episode 632 first aired, many viewers theorized that despite Violet's apparent allegiance to the Donquixote Pirates, she was actually being forced to work for them against her will. Her body language, the sadness in her eyes, and her interaction with Sanji suggested she might be a prisoner rather than a willing participant in Doflamingo's schemes.
author: One Piece Community (various viewers)

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory is confirmed in episode 639 when Violet reveals she's been working for Doflamingo under duress to protect her father

title: Luffy Will Not Win the Mera Mera no Mi
theoryText: When the Mera Mera no Mi was revealed as the tournament prize, many fans immediately theorized that Luffy would not be the one to ultimately obtain it. Some predicted another character connected to Ace would claim it, with Sabo being a popular prediction among manga readers. Anime-only viewers speculated it might go to a new ally or that Doflamingo never intended to actually give it away.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory confirmed when Sabo wins the tournament and consumes the Mera Mera no Mi

title: The Corrida Colosseum is a Trap
theoryText: Viewers theorized that the entire Corrida Colosseum tournament was an elaborate trap set by Doflamingo specifically to lure Luffy away from his alliance with Law. The use of Ace's Devil Fruit as bait was seen as a calculated psychological manipulation, exploiting Luffy's emotional connection to his late brother. Franky even acknowledges this possibility in the episode itself.
author: Community Theory

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Confirmed as Doflamingo's plan becomes clear and the trap springs on multiple levels

title: Tournament Gladiators Will Become Allies
theoryText: Early viewers theorized that many of the gladiators introduced in episode 632, particularly Cavendish and the other prominent fighters, would eventually become allies to the Straw Hats rather than enemies. The sheer number of character introductions and their detailed designs suggested they were being set up for more significant roles than simple tournament opponents.
author: Community Observation

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Confirmed when multiple gladiators including Cavendish, Bartolomeo, and others form the Straw Hat Grand Fleet

title: Violet's Devil Fruit Will Be Crucial for Intelligence
theoryText: Though Violet's Giro Giro no Mi abilities weren't fully demonstrated in episode 632, astute viewers who caught hints of her powers theorized that her clairvoyance abilities would become crucial for gathering intelligence about Doflamingo's organization and the secrets of Dressrosa. Her position as a Donquixote officer with such powerful reconnaissance abilities seemed too significant to be coincidental.
author: Power Analysis Theorists

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Confirmed as Violet uses her abilities to provide crucial intelligence to the Straw Hats
